name: New Year's Day
description: New Yearâ€™s Day is the first day of the year, or January 1, in the Gregorian calendar.

name: Lunar New Year's Day
description: Lunar New Year is the first day of the Chinese calendar, which is a lunisolar calendar mainly used for traditional celebrations.

name: Second Day of Lunar New Year
description: Second Day of Lunar New Year is a national holiday in Singapore

name: Day off for Lunar New Year's Day
description: Lunar New Year is the first day of the Chinese calendar, which is a lunisolar calendar mainly used for traditional celebrations.

name: Good Friday
description: Good Friday is a global Christian observance two days before Easter Sunday.

name: Hari Raya Puasa
description: Eid al-Fitr is a holiday to mark the end of the Islamic month of Ramadan, during which Muslims fast during the hours of daylight.

name: Labour Day
description: Labor Day, International Workers' Day, and May Day, is a day off for workers in many countries around the world.

name: Vesak Day
description: Vesak Day is a national holiday in Singapore

name: Hari Raya Haji
description: Eid al-Adha (Id ul-Adha) is an Islamic festival falling on the 10th day of the month of Dhul Hijja (Thou al-Hijja) to commemorate the willingness of Ibrahim (Abraham) to sacrifice his son.

name: National Day
description: National Day is a national holiday in Singapore

name: Diwali/Deepavali
description: Diwali, also known as the Festival of Lights, is one of the most popular Hindu festivals.

name: Christmas Day
description: Christmas Day is one of the biggest Christian celebrations and falls on December 25 in the Gregorian calendar.
